description.S1: Anton sent Jameson to Auntie Cleo's old Aunti-Biotics Lab,
description.S2: just down the road south of Roseway.
description.S3: Make sure he isn't raptidon chow.

blurb.B1: Exit the town toward Roseway Gardens,
blurb.B2: and defeat the Raptidon that attack you as you approach Auntie-Biotics Lab 0013.
blurb.B3: in the large office where you fought the Raptidons,
blurb.B4: a locked door can be opened with Cleo Lab Office Keycard,
blurb.B7: you can go in and talk to Jameson.
blurb.B8: He recognizes you and asks you what you're doing here.
blurb.B9: Tell him Anton sent you and he'll complain that Anton is always double-checking everything he does.
blurb.B10: Jameson says that Anton does not care about him and instead just wants the precursors that he is holding.
blurb.B11: You can bring up that employee death would look back for Anton,
blurb.B12: ask him for the item to test the theory, or just get going.
blurb.B13: Tell him about employee death: You will get 8250xp and Jameson will run off

description.S1: Jameson is pissed off but otherwise fine.
description.S2: Head back to Roseway to give Anton the good news.

blurb.B1: Return to Anton and talk to him to gain Auntie Cleo Reputation, 1000 Bit Cartridge and 11,000xp.

dialog.speaker: Jameson (Male)
dialog.utterance: What -- how the hell did you get in here?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: First I shot the raptidons, then I walked up the stairs, and ...

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'm very sneaky. Or rapts aren't very observant. Take your pick.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Who cares? Let's get you out of here.

dialog.speaker: Jameson (Male)
dialog.utterance: No, not -- I don't care about the beasts!

dialog.speaker: Jameson (Male)
dialog.utterance: I care about the front door! This is an egregious breach of protocol. How'd you get in?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Oh. Anton sent me to get you.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Truth be told, the raptidons did most of the work on the door. Not sure they know what a lock is.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Does it matter? You aren't trapped anymore. Let's get.

dialog.speaker: Jameson (Male)
dialog.utterance: Ugh. Can't use the centrifuge without supervision. Can't file reports without him double-checking their every word. Can't save myself from mortal peril.

dialog.speaker: Jameson (Male)
dialog.utterance: It's like he thinks I'm a child. His hands-on management style is coming to a point of contention, I tell you.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You're upset that he sent me to rescue you?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Take it up with him if you like. Now go -- before more rapts find this place.

dialog.speaker: Jameson (Male)
dialog.utterance: Please, that man doesn't have an altruistic bone in his body. I just happen to have the metabolic precursors from our last test.

dialog.speaker: Jameson (Male)
dialog.utterance: I'd wager my last bit that if you brought back the precursors and left me for dead, Anton wouldn't bat an eye.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Actually ... that isn't quite true. He said it'd look bad on him if more of his employees died.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Hand them over, then. Let's test your theory.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Well, whether he gives a shit about you or not, at least you're alive. Now, let's get out of here.

dialog.speaker: Jameson (Male)
dialog.utterance: Wonderful. That's much better. I'm getting out of here so I can personally thank him for his compassion.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Right. Stay safe.

dialog.speaker: Jameson (Male)
dialog.utterance: Wh -- what? No, come on. There's no call for that. If the way's clear, I'll head on back.

dialog.speaker: Jameson (Male)
dialog.utterance: Damnable beasts. At least I'm not trapped here anymore. I'll see you back at town.

dialog.speaker: Jameson (Male)
dialog.utterance: Fair point. I'll see you back at town.
